oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Laura Spelman Rockefeller Memorial at Newfound Gap
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This postcard depicts the Laura Spelman Rockefeller Memorial that is part of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.

The Laura Spelman Rockefeller Memorial was constructed by the Civilian Conservation Corps as part of President Roosevelt's New Deal programs in the 1930s. The two tier stone memorial was designed by the Olmstead Brothers architectural firm of Brookline, Massachusetts. This Newfound Gap landmark is one of the park's most visited historic structures and stands adjacent to the Appalachian Trail.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.)
